critique: This executive order re-establishes the President's Advisory Commission on Educational Excellence for Hispanics. It does not seem to touch on immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or economic regulation. It explicitly states that it does not create any enforceable right or benefit. The order seems to promote social inclusion and diversity by focusing on Hispanic education. It is difficult to place this order on the traditional left-right spectrum, but it seems to align with liberal values of promoting education and diversity.
